description: yellow; saucer form; deep rounded sides; slightly everted rim; interior incised with a five-clawed dragon pursuing a flaming pearl amidst clouds and flames; incised striding dragons on exterior
inscription: On the white base within the short foot  is written in underglaze blue a reign mark within a double circle, which reads: “Made in the Kangxi reign of the Great Qing”.
markings: on bottom: two dealers stickers (Lally & Co. and K.W.W-B.)
text: This dish is finely incised with a pair of writhing five-clawed dragons in pursuit of a flaming pearl amidst scrolling flames. The exterior of the gently rounded sides is similarly decorated with two striding dragons, all covered under a translucent glaze of lemon-yellow color. It is a fine example of Kangxi imperial porcelain.
title: Dish
